name: concentrated solar power plant construction, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | concentrated solar power plant, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20317/documentation

This activity represents theconstruction of a 50MW CSP parabolic trough power plant in Upington, South Africa ready for electricity production by combination of necessary components and surrounding preparation. The construction of the solar power plant requires four different units in order to produce electricity. The four key units are a collector field area, thermal storage unit, heat transport fluid system and a power block unit. Further, site preparation activities are also included in the dataset (e.g. clearing shrubs, construction of roads, fences, providing water connectivity). ;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

The activity starts with the preparation of the site (land use, access roads, buildings, water supply,  clearing shrubs, construction of roads, fences, etc.)

The activity ends when all the main units are constructed and assembled for running the power plant.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 50 MW  parabolic trough power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. 
The original data modelling a 250 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 50 MW plant design. 
Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 50 MW parabolic trough plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany.

 
Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 50 MW parabolic trough power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.

exchanges.description: Process of transforming unused area to industrial sector. Note that this dataset has been copied from a dataset valid for South Africa, where the country size allows conversion of unused grassland to area used for the CSP plant. However, in other countries it might be the case that the needed area competes with agricultural area.
All steel masses combined. Treatment of reinforced steel is used as a proxy for all steel types.
